unnormalised: ## Automotive Buzz: Traffic Rules Getting a Makeover!
normalised: ## Automotive Buzz: Traffic Rules Getting a Makeover!

unnormalised: Guess what, folks? Traffic's about to get a little less chaotic (hopefully!). Word on the street (pun intended!) is that the Ministry of Road Transport is tweaking traffic regulations, especially around festival season. Remember the Onam rush last year? Yikes!
normalised: Guess what, folks? Traffic's about to get a little less chaotic (hopefully!). Word on the street (pun intended!) is that the Ministry of Road Transport is tweaking traffic regulations, especially around festival season. Remember the Onam rush last year? Yikes!

unnormalised: Apparently, there’s talk of stricter enforcement of lane discipline on highways like NH44, especially near big cities like Bangalore and Chennai. We're hearing rumors of increased fines - maybe even Rs. 5000 for hogging the fast lane! Ouch!
normalised: Apparently, there’s talk of stricter enforcement of lane discipline on highways like N H fourty four, especially near big cities like Bangalore and Chennai. We're hearing rumors of increased fines - maybe even rupee five thousand for hogging the fast lane! Ouch!

unnormalised: Also, sources say that the new rules will focus more on pedestrian safety. Think better signage, zebra crossings, and maybe even those fancy button-operated traffic lights near schools. Good news for all those walking to school or just grabbing some biryani from their favourite spot.
normalised: Also, sources say that the new rules will focus more on pedestrian safety. Think better signage, zebra crossings, and maybe even those fancy button-operated traffic lights near schools. Good news for all those walking to school or just grabbing some biryani from their favourite spot.

unnormalised: The Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) is involved in the technical aspects, ensuring everything's up to code. They're even looking at implementing speed limits based on vehicle type - so your Maruti 800 and that fancy SUV might have different limits on the same stretch of road! Aiming for a smoother, safer ride for everyone, it seems! Let’s hope this actually works.
normalised: The Automotive Research Association of India (A R A I) is involved in the technical aspects, ensuring everything's up to code. They're even looking at implementing speed limits based on vehicle type - so your Maruti eight hundred and that fancy S U V might have different limits on the same stretch of road! Aiming for a smoother, safer ride for everyone, it seems! Let’s hope this actually works.
